DOC.brief_title: Early Versus Late Intubation Trial Physician Manned Emergency Medical Services
DOC.detailed_description: The ELITE trial prospective randomize control trial ( RCT ) compare competent EARLY-intubation LATE-intubation patient on-scene Glasgow Coma Scale ( GCS ) < 9 short ambulance transport time ( < 20 min ) hospital . The study aim establish advanced airway management endotracheal intubation ( ETI ) field specially trained Emergency Medical Services ( EMS ) physicians - compare endotracheal intubation ( ETI ) perform physician emergency department group - improve outcome term 30-day mortality , degree disability discharge , complication length hospital stay , neurologic outcome 6 month .
DOC.criteria: Adult patient ( > 18 year ) Initial GCS < 9 independent cause . Intact airway reflexes impend airway obstruction . Located < 20 min ambulance transport time near hospital emergency department . Pediatric patient ( 18 year ) . Primary cardiorespiratory arrest ( nontraumatic / medical cause ) . Planned helicopter transport hospital .
